summary: This is an internal email chain from April 2019 discussing a request from the Southern District of New York (SDNY) to obtain evidence from the earlier Epstein investigation in the Southern District of Florida (SDFL). The emails note the original office is recused and coordinate to connect SDNY with the new prosecutors handling the old case to authorize access to grand jury materials.

persons.name: Jeff Epstein
persons.context: The email states SDNY has an open criminal matter involving Jeff Epstein and is seeking evidence from the prior Florida investigation.

events.title: SDNY calls about Epstein evidence
events.description: The Criminal Chief in SDNY calls to discuss obtaining evidence from the FBI in the Southern District of Florida related to the prior Epstein investigation.

events.title: Coordination on evidence access
events.description: Internal emails are exchanged to facilitate SDNY's access to grand jury materials from the Florida investigation, noting the original office is recused.

keyFacts: In April 2019, the Southern District of New York (SDNY) had an open criminal matter involving Jeff Epstein and was actively seeking evidence from the prior Florida investigation.
The Miami FBI was reluctant to send materials to the SDNY FBI without a specific authorization letter (a '6e letter').
The original U.S. Attorney's Office that handled the Florida case was recused from the underlying criminal matter and therefore could not authorize the evidence transfer.
The email chain aims to connect SDNY with the new prosecutors handling the old Florida case to obtain the necessary authorization for the grand jury materials.
